satu cara untuk meningkatkan
lingkungan perdagangan
dengan memberikan kerangka
kerja dan peraturan, namun
yang lebih penting dari
kesemuanya itu adalah fondasi
dan ekosistem untuk
mendukung dan membuat
kerangka kerja dan perjanjian
itu berfungsi.

Indonesia sarankan perlunya
mengupayakan konektivitas di
kawasan, pemanfaatan
teknologi digital inovatif,
pengembangan sumber daya
manusia dan ekonomi
pembangunan yang
berkelanjutan.

Poin 3.a. dan 4
KSEA
90 Indonesia menjawab
pertanyaan mengenai
pendanaan Public Private
Partnership (PPP) di Indonesia
yang terdiri dari 3 jenis
investasi. Pertama, apabila
proyek tersebut memiliki nilai
finansial dan ekonomi yang baik
maka akan diberikan kepada
BUMN. Kedua, apabila proyek
tersebut memiliki nilai finansial
yang rendah dan ekonomi yang
baik maka akan diberikan
kepada skema PPP. Ketiga,
apabila proyek tersebut
memiliki nilai finansial dan
ekonomi yang rendah maka
pendanaannya akan dibebankan
kepada pemerintah.`

92 Electronic Commerce – Pada
putaran ini, terdapat kemajuan
yang cukup signifikan dimana
ASEAN telah menyampaikan
paket proposal untuk pasal 15
(Location of Computing
Facilities) dan 17 (Cross Border
Transfer of Information by
Electronic Means) yaitu adanya
footnote terkait pengaturan
periode transisi bagi CLMV,
adanya footnote spesifik untuk
Indonesia, dan adanya self-
judgement untuk legitimate
public policy objectives.
Indonesia masih
mempertahankan footnote yang
telah disampaikan pada Putaran
Melbourne, namun telah
menyampaikan informasi
bahwa terdapat kemungkinan
adanya improved position dari
Indonesia berdasarkan hasil
koordinasi dalam negeri yang
saat ini masih berlangsung.

Realisasi Persentase prakarsa dan rekomendasi
yang diterima
98,17%

Persentase prakarsa/rekomendasi Indonesia di bidang ekonomi, sosial dan budaya
yang diterima dalam kerja sama Multilateral

Jumlah promosi Trade Tourism and Investment (TTI) di kawasan Amerika dan Eropa

NO KEGIATAN KETERANGAN DATA DUKUNG
AMERIKA I
1.  Partisipasi delegasi Indonesia dalam
Seafood Expo North America (SENA)
Direktorat Amerika I
memfasilitasi
partisipasi 15 eksportir
dan 1 asosiasi dalam
pameran dimaksud.
Selain itu, telah
dilakukan pembahasan
perkembangan
penerapan Seafood
Import Monitoring
Program (SIMP) serta
draft Li st of Foreign
Fisheries (LoFF) dengan
National Oceanic and
Atmospheric
Administration
(NOAA), launcing
”Indonesia One -by-One
Tuna Brand”  serta
“Shrimp Industry
Improvement and
Investment”
Laporan Pameran Seafood Expo
North America (SENA) 2019 dan
Pengamanan Akses Pasar Produk
Perikanan Indonesia di Boston,
Amerika Serikat, 17 -19 Maret
2019
2.  Fasilitasi partisipasi 5 eksportir
Indonesia dari berbagai bidang dalam
ExpoComer.
Pameran Expocomer
diselenggarakan di
Atlapa Convention
Center, Panama City
pada 27 -30 Maret
2019. Pameran diikuti
oleh lebih dari 30
negara dengan total
670 booth.
Partisipasi Indonesia
diwakili oleh Indofood,
Asietex, PT. Sinar Sri
Rejeki Utomo, CV Karya
Hidup Sentosa, serta
CV Primajati
 KBRI Panama City No.
00063/PANAMA CITY/190405
perihal Laporan Kegiatan
Expocomer, 27-30 Maret 2019 di
Panama City

dengan pelaku usaha.
Pertemuan tersebut
diselenggarakan di
Santo Domingo,
Republik Dominika
pada 26 September
2019. Pertemuan
dilaksanakan untuk
mendorong d an
membuka akses bagi
produk-produk
Indonesia sekaligus
untuk mempromosikan
Nota Dinas No.
75077/BK/10/2019/35 perihal
Laporan Pelaksanaan Business
Meeting dan pertemuan dengan
Kementerian Luar Negeri
Republik Dominika di Santo
Domingo, 24 -27 September
2019

pameran dagang di
Indonesia

B.2.8
SUB IKU-8: PERSENTASE NASKAH MENGENAI KEBIJAKAN INDONESIA DI BIDANG EKONOMI, SOSIAL

respon Keterangan

dimuat di berbagai
media berbahasa
asing

B.3PELAYANAN DANPERLINDUNGAN WNI DAN BHI YANG PRIMA
LAPORAN KINERJA
TAHUN 2019
KEMENTERIAN LUAR NEGERIREPUBLIK INDONESIA

B.3.1

Indeks Penyelesaian Kasus WNI
dan BHI di luar negeri

NO PERJANJIAN KERJA SAMA
INTEGRASI
KETERANGAN
KEGIATAN KODIFIKASI DATA DUKUNG Penghitungan
(1) (2) (3) (4) (5)
1 Integrasi Portal Peduli WNI dengan
SIAK Dukcapil Kementerian Dalam
Negeri
Dit. Perlindungan WNI dan BHI telah
melaksanakan penyusunan Standar
Operasional Prosedur (SOP)
Penerbitan Nomor Identitas Tunggal
(NIT) bagi WNI di luar negeri dengan
Ditjen Kependudukan dan Pencatatan
Sipil Kementerian Dalam Negeri
Pada tanggal 3-5 Oktober
2019 Dit. Perlindungan WNI
dan BHI telah
melaksanakan rapat tindak
lanjut penyusunan Standar
Operasional Prosedur (SOP)
penerbitan NIT di luar negeri
dengan Ditjen
Kependudukan dan
Pencatatan Sipil
Kementerian Dalam Negeri
Draf Standar Operasional
Prosedur (SOP) Penerbitan Nomor
Identitas Tunggal (NIT) bagi WNI
di luar negeri dalam nota dinas
Direktur Perlindungan WNI dan
BHI Nomor:
01184/WN/10/2019/66 tanggal 15
Oktober 2019 perihal Laporan
Kegiatan Rapat Tindak Lanjut
Penyusunan Standar Operasional
Prosedur (SOP) Penerbitan NIT di
Luar Negeri dan Finalisasi Nota
Kesepahaman antara
Kementerian Luar Negeri dan
Kementerian Agama tentang
Pelayanan, Pengelolaan Informasi
dan Dokumentasi Nikah bagi
Warga Negara Indonesia di Luar
Negeri
Tahapan Draft = 75%
2 Integrasi Portal Peduli WNI dengan
SIMKAH Kementerian Agama
Dit. Perlindungan WNI dan BHI telah
melaksanakan finalisasi draf nota
kesepahaman antara Kementerian
Luar Negeri dengan Kementerian
Agama terkait pelayanan,
pengelolaan informasi dan
dokumentasi nikah bagi WNI di luar
negeri
Pada tanggal 3-5 Oktober
2019 Dit. Perlindungan WNI
dan BHI telah
melaksanakan finalisasi draf
nota kesepahaman antara
Kementerian Luar Negeri
dengan Kementerian
Agama terkait pelayanan,
pengelolaan informasi dan
dokumentasi nikah bagi
WNI di luar negeri
Draf Nota Kesepahaman antara
Kementerian Luar Negeri dan
Kementerian Agama tentang
Pelayanan dan Pelindungan WNI
di Luar Negeri dalam nota dinas
Direktur Perlindungan WNI dan
BHI Nomor:
01184/WN/10/2019/66 tanggal 15
Oktober 2019 perihal Laporan
Kegiatan Rapat Tindak Lanjut
Penyusunan Standar Operasional
Prosedur (SOP) Penerbitan NIT di
Luar Negeri dan Finalisasi Nota
Kesepahaman antara
Kementerian Luar Negeri dan
Kementerian Agama tentang
Pelayanan, Pengelolaan Informasi
dan Dokumentasi Nikah bagi
Warga Negara Indonesia di Luar
Negeri
Tahapan Draft = 75%
Formulasi Perhitungan:
(IPW × 40%) + (IKL × 60%)
IPW: Persentase Integrasi database Perwakilan RI dengan database Direktorat Jenderal Protokol dan Konsuler
IKL: Persentase dokumen kesepakatan integrasi dengan K/L terkait yang ditandatangani
IPW = (PW ÷ PT) × 100%
PW: Perwakilan RI yang diintegrasikan
PT: Target jumlah Perwakilan RI yang akan diintegrasikan
IKL = Nilai Bobot Tahapan
Nilai Bobot Tahapan Proses:
- R (Rumusan): tahapan proses sampai dengan tahap Perumusan = 40%
- D (Draft): tahapan proses sampai dengan tahap Penyelesaian Draft = 75%
- S (Signed): tahapan proses sampai dengan tahap Penandatanganan = 100%
MATRIKS INFORMASI KINERJA INTEGRASI

NO.  ITEM SUMMARY RELATED
DOCUMENTS
ACTION TO BE
TAKEN POSISI INDONESIA SUGGESTED INTERVENTION
REPORT OF THE
SECRETARY-GENERAL
ON CREDENTIALS

Note by the Secretariat

delegations to the 106th
session of the Legal
Committee

Committee is
requested to
transmit to the
Secretary-General
credentials issued
in accordance with
the provisions of the
above-mentioned
rule in respect of its
representatives and
alternates, if any.
4.  106/3

FACILITATION OF THE
ENTRY INTO FORCE AND
HARMONIZED
INTERPRETATION OF
THE 2010 HNS
PROTOCOL

note on the status of work
on the 2010 HNS Protocol

LEG 105/14
and Assembly
resolution
A.1123(30)

invited to  take note
of the information
contained in this
document and to
comment, as
appropriate.
-  Sekretariat IMO mendorong negara
anggota untuk meratifikasi HNS
Convention 2010
- HNS Convention 2010 belum entry
into force, dibutuhkan 8 negara lagi
untuk Entry into force.
- Untuk Fund Convention 1992, status
Indonesia hanya sebagai observer
Kemenkomar:
Posisi terakhir Indonesia sudah
sampai dimana?

6.  106/3/2

FACILITATION OF THE
ENTRY INTO FORCE AND
HARMONIZED
INTERPRETATION OF
THE 2010 HNS
PROTOCOL

Report on administrative
preparations for the setting
up of the HNS Fund

Submitted by the
International Oil Pollution
Compensation Funds
(IOPC Funds)

This document provides an
update on the work carried
out by the 1992 Fund
Secretariat with regard to
the administrative tasks
necessary for the setting up
of the HNS Fund and its
intentions with regard to the
preparations for the first
session of the HNS
Assembly.
 The Committee is
invited to take note
of the information
contained in this
document and
comment as it may
deem appropriate.
Hal-hal yang terkait dengan
penyusunan regulasi HNS Protocol
2010 saat ini Pemri melalui
Kementerian Koordinator Bidang
Kemaritiman terus melakukan
pembahasan dengan K/L terkait, untuk
menyusun strategi dan kebijakan
nasional terkait pemberlakuan HNS
Protocol 2010.

Matters related to the current provisions
HNS Protocol regulations of the
Government of Indonesia through the
Ministry of Maritime Affairs
Coordinating Ministry continue to
discuss with relevant Ministries /
Agencies, for national development
strategies and policies the
implementation of the HNS Protocol

PIC: Kemenko Maritim dan Ditjen
Hubla
Konsep draft intervensi

Indonesia sedang dalam posisi
domestic consultation  dan
mempertimbangkan untuk menjadi
party 2010 HNS Convention

Indonesia apresiasi pada IMO
untuk upaya yang dilakukan
dan strategi terkait regulasi
kebijakan nasional terkait
pemberlakuan HNS Protocol

Indonesia dapat berkomunikasi
dengan Secretariat IOPC Fund
technical cooperation  (workshop
on IOPC Fund)
Kesediaan Indonesia untuk
menjadi HOST program /
workshop ITCP 2020.

8.  106/4/1

PROVISION OF
FINANCIAL SECURITY IN
CASE OF
ABANDONMENT OF
SEAFARERS, AND
SHIPOWNERS'
RESPONSIBILITIES IN
RESPECT OF
CONTRACTUAL CLAIMS
FOR PERSONAL INJURY
TO, OR DEATH OF
SEAFARERS IN LIGHT OF
THE PROGRESS OF
AMENDMENTS TO THE
ILO MARITIME LABOUR
CONVENTION, 2006

Submitted by ICS

This document co mments
on the current global
abandonment situation and
current concerns


IMO/ILO/WGLC
CS5/3


The Committee is
invited to:

1. note the
information
contained in this
document;
2. invite Member
States and
relevant
organizations to
advise ILO and
IMO of any
information in
relation to cases
listed in the
IMO/ILO joint
database; and
3. consider ways in
which it can
address the
current
challenges faced
by those affected
by
abandonment,
1. Sebagaimana hasil sidang pada LEG
IMO ke -105 tahun 2018, telah
merekomendasikan agar bebera pa
negara anggota IMO segera
mempertimbangkan pengesahan
konvensi IOPC Funds, OPRC, ILO
C188 dan CTA.

2. Oleh karena itu Pemerintah
Indonesia berkewajiban untuk
melaporkan posisi dan berbagai
perkembangan penyusunan
regulasi yang telah dilakukan
sebagai contoh rencana
pengesahan Konvensi ILO 188,
CTA, IOPC Funds, OPRC.

3.  Terkait dengan hal tersebut saat ini
Pemri melalui Kementerian
Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman
sedang mengkoordinasikan
percepatan pengesahan konvensi -
konvensi dimaksud yakni :

a. Konvensi SCTW -F, posisi saat ini
sudah di meja Presiden menunggu
proses penandatangan dan
pengesahan Presiden;
MASUKAN DIT. PERLINDUNGAN
WNI DAN BHI

The Government of the Republic of
Indonesia would like to express
our appreciation for the support we
have received pertaining to the
abandonment cases involving
Indonesian seafarers overseas.

Having learned from the
experiences, Indonesia would like
to highlight the importance of the
cooperation among all parties;
Port States, Flag States,
States of Nationality of the
Seafarers as well as the union, not
only in reporting and identifying
abandonment cases, but also in
finding effective solutions to such
cases.

With regard to financial security
Indonesia is of the view that it will
help to enable prompt repatriation
process and remuneration claims
for the abandoned seafarers.

Workshop LEG Per 21 Maret 2019

NO.  ITEM SUMMARY RELATED
DOCUMENTS
ACTION TO BE
TAKEN POSISI INDONESIA SUGGESTED INTERVENTION
including
encouraging
further
ratification of
MLC, 2006 and
reminding States
Parties and other
stakeholders of
their
responsibilities
towards
abandoned
seafarers; the
sponsors
welcome
suggestions to
be made in this
regard during the
meeting.
b. Konvensi IOPC dan OPRC,  yang
saat ini proses penyusunan yang
akan di lead oleh Kementerian
Perhubungan;
c. Konvensi CTA yang akan di lead
oleh KKP,
d. terkait konvensi Konvensi ILO 188,
saat ini terdapat 14 negara yang
sudah meratifikasi Konvensi ILO
188 yaitu Angola, Afrika Selatan,
Norwegia, Maroko, Lithuania,
Perancis, Estonia, Kongo, Bosnia
and Herzegovina, dan Argentina, 4
diantaranya belum entry in to force
yaitu Namibia, Senegal, Thailand
dan Inggris.

     Saat ini Pemri berpandangan bahwa
ratifikasi memang perlu untuk
dilakukan, namun terlebih dahulu
perlu memperhatikan  kembali
terkait kesiapan teknis dan
penerapan aturan di tingkat
nasional. Sa at ini Indonesia telah
memiliki beberapa peraturan
nasional terkait pelaksanaan
perlindungan tenaga kerja bidang
kemaritiman khususnya
perlindungan ABK di kapal niaga
dengan telah meratifikasi MLC
2006, namun dalam pelaksanaan
peraturan tersebut, masih ter dapat
kendala dalam hal koordinasi antara
Kementerian teknis terkait.

     Selain itu saat ini negara yang telah
meratifikasi Konvensi C 188 adalah
negara-negara yang bukan negara -
negara yang menjadi tujuan supply
.
However, Indonesia would like to
raise attention to costs that may
incur in the event of abandonment
of vessels such as towage,
payment for skeleton crews etc.
Based on Indonesia’s experience
the lack of funding for these kinds
of costs , may also hinder the
repatriation process.  In this
regards, Indonesia believes it is
high time for IMO, in cooperation
with ILO, to establish guidelines on
the issue  particularly on
governmental responsibilities in
the event of abandonment. .

Lastly, In donesia support the
establishment of List of competent
of authorities and organizations
as a tool to expedite
communication and coordination
among respective parties.
.

Workshop LEG Per 21 Maret 2019

NO.  ITEM SUMMARY RELATED
DOCUMENTS
ACTION TO BE
TAKEN POSISI INDONESIA SUGGESTED INTERVENTION
tenaga kerja dari Indonesia.
Sehingga pen erapan Konvensi C
188 juga tidak akan maksimal
karena negara -negara tersebut
belum meratifikasi.
     Oleh karenanya dalam proses
ratifikasi, perlu juga melibatkan
pihak-pihak yang terdampak atas
ratifikasi tersebut.
MASUKAN DIT. PERLINDUNGAN WNI
DAN BHI

1. Indonesia mengapresiasi database
IMO dan ILO yang mengakomodir
seluruh pekerja di atas kapal, tidak
hanya pelaut tapi juga nelayan.
2. Indonesia dapat mendukung
penerbitan List of competent of
authorities and organizations
sebagai salah satu tools untuk
mempercepat penanganan kasus -
kasus penelantaran pelaut.
3. Terkait ketentuan pengenal
financial security , diharapkan
IMO/ILO dapat menerbitkan
guidelines terkait:
a. Tanggung jawab negara
anggota;
b. mekanisme claim terhadap
financial security dalam kasus
penelantaran; dan
c. pembiayaan terkait kapal
terlantar (towage,
maintenance, dsb) melalui
skema financial security

ILO MARITIME LABOUR
CONVENTION, 2006

Analysis of incidents of
abandonment for the period
1 January to 31 December
2018

Submitted by the
International Transport
Workers' Federation

This report considers cases
of aba ndonment reported
by ITF to the IMO/ILO joint
database on abandonme nt
of seafarers for a period of
one year from 1 January
2018 to 31 December 2018
LEG 105/4/3,
LEG 105/4/2
and LEG
106/4/3
The Committee is
invited to take note
of the information
provided and
maintain its interest
in, and oversight of,
the issue of
seafarer
abandonment.
Related to the development of the
implementation of the 2006 MLC
ratification, as follows:

a. Indonesia have agreed that the
implementation of inspections will be
carried out jointly between the
Ministry of Transportation and the
Ministry of Manpower, with each
Ministry establishing a mechanism for
implementing joint supervision.

b. As a first step regarding the annual
report that the Ministry of Manpower
must submit to the ILO, the Ministry of
Manpower and the Ministry of
Transportation will jointly arrange it
with the mechanism to be discussed
further. As a follow-up, the Ministry of
Manpower will send a letter to the
Ministry of Transportation regarding
the test of checking supervision and
requesting material for reports to the
ILO;

c. As a follow -up, the Ministry of
Transportation and the Ministry of
Manpower agreed to provide and
improve the capacity of the Labor
Inspector and Marine Inspector in the
context of supervision so that they will
carry out training and education in
each of their supervisors, and in this
regard will invite institutions that
conduct training and education
discussing the curriculum and
competencies that must be owned by
marine inspectors and labor
inspectors so that the implementation
PIC : Kemenko Maritim dan
Kemlu : Dit PWNI
Penyampaian ucapan terima
kasih atas peran serta dan
bantuan dari pihak IMO, ILO dan
FAO dalam membantu
penyelesain kasus di bawah.

Tindak Lanjut Penanganan ABK
Kapal Miss Gaunt dan ABK
Northwind yang Terlantar di
Mumbai, India Serta ABK Kapal
AHT Carrier di Mozambik , yakni
terkait terhadap penanganan 8
(delapan) orang ABK WNI di Kapal
Miss Gaunt dan 5 (lima) orang
ABK WNI di Kapal Northwind yang
ditahan oleh otoritas pelabuhan di
Mumbai, India serta penanganan 8
(delapan) orang ABK WNI di Kapal
AHT Carrier yang ditahan oleh
otoritas pelabuhan Maputo,
Mozambik.


PFKKI:
Perlu direview apa yang menjadi
perhatian pada masalah pelaut?

Abandonment:
- Ada 2 tahap rekrutmen yaitu dari
Kemhub dan BNP2TKI
- agar bisa dipetakan mana
perusahaan yg baik dan tidak
- harus ada data base nasional
terkait pelaut

TAKEN POSISI INDONESIA SUGGESTED INTERVENTION
of the Joint Inspection can be carried
out continuously in accordance with
the provisions of the MLC 2006;

MASUKAN DIT. PERLINDUNGAN
WNI DAN BHI

The government of the Republic of
Indonesia takes note on the
analysis provided by the
International Transport Workers’
Federation.

Since 2015, the Ministry of Foreign
Affairs of the Republic of Indonesia
has established database on the
Indonesian citiz ens overseas and
cases reported to Indonesian
missions. This database also
registered numbers of cases
occurred to Indonesian seafarers
and fishers.  In 2018 we registered
1.165 reported cases of
Indonesian seafarers/fishers  all
over the world. Around 10% of the
cases were abandonment cases.

With a view to increase the
accuracy of data and expedite the
resolution of abandonment cases,
our government welcome
cooperation with IMO, ILO and the
union regarding exchange of data
and information.

ADVICE AND GUIDANCE

THE IMPLEMENTATION
OF IMO INSTRUMENTS

Implementation of IMO
instruments in the maritime
areas adjacent to the
temporarily occupied
Autonomous Republic of
Crimea and the city of
Sevastopol, Ukraine

Submitted by Ukraine

This document again draws
the attention of the
Committee to the Russian
Federation's unlawful
unilateral actions in  the
temporarily occupied part of
the territory of Ukraine,
namely, the Autonomous
Republic of Crimea and city
of Sevastopol (hereinafter
"Crimea"), and the
consequences of such
unlawful actions for the
implementation of IMO
instruments in the northern
part of the Black Sea,
including in maritime areas
adjacent to Crimea.

regional ASEAN (MTWG).

Ada 2 draft dokumen yang disubmit
oleh Secretariat IMO dan USA

COMMUNICATION OF

bisa dishare dalam penanganan
fraudulent registry ships?

PIC : Ditjen Hubla : Ditkapel

Establishing communication of
Information to the IMO for assisting
In combating fraudulent
registration and fraudulent
registries
Objectives :
a) Establish network of
communication for
verification of ship
registration; and
b) Share best practice on ship
registration and
deregistration.
to strengthen ship registration and
create a network to effectively
control ships in the region. The
proposed types of activities are as
follows:
a) Establish network of
communication for
verification of ship
registration;

18.  106/7/3

MEASURES TO PREVENT
UNLAWFUL PRACTICES
ASSOCIATED WITH THE
FRAUDULENT
REGISTRATION AND
FRAUDULENT
REGISTRIES OF SHIPS

Unlawful registration of
ships in the temporarily
occupied Autonomous
Republic of Crimea and the
city of Sevastopol, Ukraine

Submitted by Ukraine

This document draws the
attention of the Committee
to the unlawful issuance of
certificates for the right to
sail under the flag of the
Russian Federation by the
Russian authorities in the
temporarily occupied part of
the territory of Ukraine,
namely, the Autonomous
Republic of Crimea and city
of Sevastopol.
A 30/21/2, A
30/INF.8; LEG
104/15; LEG
105/6/3, LEG
105/11, LE G
105/11/5;
Circular Letters
No.3453,
3477, 3490,
3777, 3830
and 3882
Ukraine suggests
that the port State
control officers
should confirm
information about a
vessel's flag in the
Ship and Company
Particulars module
of GISIS in order to
reduce unlawful
practices
associated with the
fraudulent
registration of ships.

The Committee is
invited to note the
information
provided, consider
the proposal and
take action, as
appropriate.

List of instruments under the
purview of the Legal
Committee

Note by the Secretariat

This document provides a
list of mandatory
instruments under the
purview of the Committee,
which may be considered
as part of the regulatory
scoping exercise for the use
of Maritime Autonom ous
Surface Ships (MASS).
LEG 105/10;
LEG 105/11/1;
LEG 105/14;
MSC 99/22;
and MSC
100/20
The Committee is
invited to:

1. take note of the
information
contained in the
annex and
comment, as
appropriate; and
2. consider which
instruments
should be
evaluated as part
of the regulatory
scoping exercise
and gap analysis.
Hal-hal yang terkait dengan
penyusunan regulasi Maritime
Autonomous Surface Ship (MAS, saat
ini Pemri melalui Kementerian
Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman terus
melakukan pembahasan dengan K/L
terkait, untuk menyusun strategi dan
kebijakan nasional terkait dengan
MASS.
Mengkaji lebih lanjut rencana
Autonomous Surface Ships di MSC
101.
Indonesia belum ada rencana
pengaturan  regulasi terkait  MASS.
Ada beberapa tipe MASS:
- ada yang lewat control
-ada yg fully autonomous control
Usulan negara-negara eropa, korea,
dll:
Workplan nya dibahas sampai 2022.

Maritim

dan diharapakan untuk secara
continue diikuti oleh Indonesia karena
akan ada share contact point.
Di eropa ada yang sudah menjalankan
dan akan terus berlanjut, diperlukan
posisi awal Pemri dan kehati-hatian
karena geografi indonesia yg sangat
kompleks.

Kemlu:
Posisi awal Indonesia
1. Bahwa Indonesia mengakui
kemajuan teknologi tanpa
mengabaikan kedaulatan negara;
2. MASS harus sesuai UNCLOS;
3. Tidak ada special treatment untuk
MASS, harus comply dengan regulasi
yang telah ada.
Pada LEG, terkait MASS yang akan
dibahas adalah liability.

Workshop LEG Per 21 Maret 2019

NO.  ITEM SUMMARY RELATED
DOCUMENTS
ACTION TO BE
TAKEN POSISI INDONESIA SUGGESTED INTERVENTION

Report on technical
cooperation activities on
maritime legislation for 2018

Note by the Secretariat

A. Workshop on IMO Civil Liability and
Compensations Conventions
1. pada tanggal 18 -21 September
2018 di Bali, yang merupakan
kerjasama Kemenko Maritim
dengan IMO, dengan
menghadirkan 3 narasumber ahli
dari IMO yakni dari kantor Divisi
Hukum IMO yang diwakili oleh
Bapak Jan Engel de Boer,
Penasihat Hukum dari Sekretariat
Dana IOPC yang diwakili oleh Mr.
Kensuke Kobayashi dan
perwakilan dari International
Group of P & I Clubs yang diwakili
oleh Mr. David Bolomini.
2. Tujuan dari kegiatan ini adalah
kesiapan Indonesia dalam
meratifikasi berbagai konvensi
terkait CLC untuk membangu n
kapasitas dalam memahami
fungsi kebijakan di bidang
kemaritiman serta
implementasinya dalam peraturan
perundang-undangan nasional
kita baik yang telah ada aturannya
maupun yang belum ada’
3. Rekomendasi :
a. Perlu segera melakukan rakor
tindak lanjut gun a membahas
alasan mengapa Indonesia
masih menjadi pihak dalam
Konvensi 1969 CLC Fund
sementara negara -negara lain
telah bermigrasi ke 1992
Konvensi Dana CLC dan
Protokol Dana Tambahan 2003;
b. Indonesia sebagai negara
kepulauan yang menyediakan 3

Workshop LEG Per 21 Maret 2019

NO.  ITEM SUMMARY RELATED
DOCUMENTS
ACTION TO BE
TAKEN POSISI INDONESIA SUGGESTED INTERVENTION
(tiga) j alur laut internasional
untuk navigasi dan memiliki
Chock Point utama di Selat
Malaka yang melayani navigasi
lebih dari 90 kapal per tahun,
kiranya perlu
mempertimbangkan untuk
meratifikasi konvensi -konvensi
yang belum diratifikasi dengan
melihat skala pri oritas untuk
kepentingan dan manfaatnya
bagi  Indonesia;
c. Meyeleraskan berbagai
peraturan nasional tentang
penghancuran bangkai kapal
dan penyelamatan pelayaran
agar selaras the 2007 Nairobi
WRC and the 1989 Salvage
Convention.
B.  Technical Seminar on the
International Maritime Organization-
Cape Town Agreement di Bali,
tanggal 31 Oktober - 2 November
2018.
    1.Technical Seminar on the
International Maritime Organization
- Cape Town Agreement (IMO-CTA)
diselenggarakan sebagai hasil
kerjasama antara Kementerian
Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman
dengan the International Maritime
Organization dan Pew Trusts.
2. pelatihan tersebut menghadirkan
narasumber
   a) IMO: Ms. Josephin Uranza,
b) ILO: Mr. Brandt Wagner;
c) Pew Charitable Trusts: Courtney
Farthing dan Kimberly Vosburgh,

Workshop LEG Per 21 Maret 2019

NO.  ITEM SUMMARY RELATED
DOCUMENTS
ACTION TO BE
TAKEN POSISI INDONESIA SUGGESTED INTERVENTION
d) Lloyd’s Register Foundation:
Daryll Attwood;
e) International Experts: Ari
Gudmundsson, dan Nigel
Campbell.
3. bertujuan untuk memberikan
pemahaman mengenai pentingnya
Indonesia meratifikasi IMO -CTA
yang merupakan satu dari empat
pilar pemberantasan IUUF (FAO -
PSMA, ILO-C-188, ILO-STCW, IMO-
CTA) dan menilai kesiapan
Indonesia dalam rangka penerapan
IMO-CTA, hal ini terkait  masalah-
masalah yang sering dihadapi oleh
Indonesia ketika kapal perikanan
Indonesia  berlayar keluar wilayah
Indonesia, ketika pelaut perikanan
Indonesia bekerja sebagai anak
buah kapal di kapal perikanan asing,
dan termasuk ketika Kapal Ikan
asing masuk di wilayah Indonesia.
4. Rekomendasi
a) Mengakui bahwa berlakunya CTA
akan memberikan dampak positif
terhadap keselamatan kapal
perikanan secara global dan pelaut
perikanan indonesia yang bekerja di
Luar Negeri dan mengetahui bahwa
berbagai tantangan perlu diatasi.
b) Mendukung kelanjutan kerjasama
dan koordinasi antar semua instansi
pusat terkait dengan semua pih ak
terkait untuk mengatasi
keselamatan kapal, iuuf, dan
standar kondisi kerja yang dapat
diterima.
c) Membuat analisis biaya -
keuntungan ttg penerapan

tahun jntuk proses aksesi.

programme on “Unified
Interpretation on
the test for breaking the
owner’s right to limit liability
under the IMO conventions”

Submitted by Greece, the
Marshall Islands,
International Chamber of
Shipping and International
Group of Protection and

liability, given (a) the
fundamental importance of
this right, which underpins
the conventions and (b) that
the long -term sustainability
of the liabili ty and
compensation system
depends upon uniform
implementation consistent
with the intention of the
conventions, rather than an
application or interpretation
that varies from country to
country.

The co -sponsors therefore
propose that the Committee
considers a new work
output for the development
of an aid to interpretation of
one of the key principles
underlying the system by
means of a Unified
Interpretation of the test for
breaking the shipowner ’s
right to limit liability. This
would ensure consistency
among States Parties while
continuing to recognize that
the courts in States Parties
are ultimately the final
arbiters.

Fair treatment of seafarers
detained on suspicion of
committing maritime crimes

Submitted by Georgia,
Ukraine and the
International Transport
Workers' Federation

This document draws the
attention of the Legal
Committee to the serious
problem of involvement of
seafarers in criminal
activities at sea and of the
violation of seafarers' rights
to fair treatment in the event
of their detention on
suspicion of committing
crimes related to m aritime
trade and transportation.

information
provided, consider

take action, as
appropriate

and

seafarers'
involvement in
maritime crimes
and to ensure

fair treatment in
case of their
detention on
suspicion of

MASUKAN DIT. PERLINDUNGAN WNI
DAN BHI

1. Indonesia memandang penting
Consular notication dalam kasus -
kasus penangkapan pelaut
Indonesia di luar negeri.

2. Pemilik kapal atau agen yang
ditunjuk, selaku pemberi kerja,
bertanggung jawab penuh menjamin
ketersediaan fasilitas pendampingan
hukum dan penterjemah ba gi pelaut
yang menghadapi proses hukumm.

3. Dalam hal negara pantai tidak
menyediakan kedua fasilitas
tersebut, biaya fasilitasi dibeb ankan
kepada pemilik kapal/agen

4. Negara Bendera wajib melakukan
pengawasan terhadap kapal -kapal
yang terdaftar di negaranya,
termasuk mengambil alih tanggung
jawab pemilik kapal dalam hal
pemilik gagal menjalankan kewajiban
kontraktualnya terhadap pelaut dan
kapal.
MASUKAN DIT. PERLINDUNGAN
WNI DAN BHI

The Government of the Republic of
Indonesia would like to make
reference to the results of the ILO
Sectoral Tripartite Meeting on
Recruitment and Retention of
Seafarers and the Promotion of
Opportunities of Women.

As we recognize , that seafarers
are often at risk of criminalization
following maritime disasters,
incidents, accidents at sea or while
in port. Some may have been
criminalized for the illegal activities
on board that they are unaware of,
thus resulting in detention and loss
of remuneration.

 In this meeting, the Government
of the Republic of Indonesia would
like to re emphasize the
importance of consular
notification, access to legal aid and
due process of law , and call upon
all parties to contribute so that fair
treatment for seafarers can
manifest in such a situation.

APPENDIX 1 : Cooperation on Ship Registration

Workshop LEG Per 21 Maret 2019


Concept Note
Cooperation on Ship Registration

Introduction
Ship registration is the key administrative process to control the ships under jurisdiction of a State. It is an obligation o f a flag State under
UNCLOS (Article 94 Duties of the flag State) and IMO Assembly Resolution A. 932 (22) – Measures to Prevent the  Registration of
“Phantom” Ships – for Governments to collaborate with other States to verify registration evidence. Ship registration, as a control measure,
is also specified in the FAO in the International Plan of Action to Prevent, Deter and Eliminate Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated Fishing
(IPOA-IUU) and the Voluntary Guidelines for Flag State Performance.
In recent years  IMO Member States has enhanced its control of ship registration  by amending the regulation on ship registration and
improving the database of ship registry . There is an increasing demand to cooperate  on ship registration with IMO Member States in the
region to strengthen ship registration and create a network to effectively control ships in the region.
Objectives of future cooperation
- Prevent the registration of “Phantom” ships and flag hopping of black-listed fishing vessels
- Improve communication between Member States in the region on ship registration
Type of Activities
- Establish network of communication for verification of ship registration
- Share best practice on ship registration and deregistration
- Harmonise ship registration procedure in the region to comply with international requirements
- Create bilateral or multilateral agreement/MoU of cooperation





APPENDIX 2 : Agenda Piracy in SOMS

Workshop LEG Per 21 Maret 2019






































APPENDIX 3 : Implementasi INAPORTNET di Indonesia

INAPORTNET INDONESIA

Workshop LEG Per 21 Maret 2019

Indonesia dapat menyampaikan pengalamannya tentang progress implementasi inaportnet di Indonesia, dimana Inaportnet saat ini telah di berlaku di
16 pelabuhan di Indonesia.

INAPORTNET is a system in a portal operated and integrated with all activities both service and clearance from all relevant agencies (other government
agencies) doing activity in the port. Basically, the usage of this system is to improve the handling performance of trading and traffic of goods, especially
the acceleration process of port clearance. Therefore, it allowed the delivery of documents through one gateway portal which is accessible from th e
location or their entity connecting to INAPORTNET. As a part of the implementation of Indonesia National Single Window (INSW) , INAPORTNET is
expected to be able to be integrated into INSW portal before the application of INSW.

The Ministry of Transportation began to implement a single internet-based service system called Inaportnet in four major ports namely Makassar Port,
Belawan, Tanjung Priok, including at Tanjung Perak Port as the initial stage. Furthermore, the implementation of Inaportnet will be used in 16 ports in
Indonesia in total.

The Inaportnet System will later integrate a standard port information system to serve vessels and goods for both import and export ship activities
involving service systems at Head Office of Ministry of Transportation. Through this system is expected to improve ship service in the port in order to
run fast, reliable, transparent, and standardized and minimal cost.

Indonesia would like to share information on our INAPORTNET implementation. It was informed that in 20 18 there are 16 major ports that has
implemented INAPORNET system. In 2019, Indonesia has plan to expand to other 14 ports so, the total number of 30 ports is expected to be fully
implemented the INAPORTNET system.

As a part of the implementation of Indonesia National Single Window (INSW), INAPORTNET is expected to be able to be integrated into INSW portal
before the application of INSW.

Starting from 2017, The Ministry of Transportation began to implement a single internet -based service system called Inaportnet in four major ports
namely Makassar Port, Belawan, Tanjung Priok, including at Tanjung Perak Port as the initial stage.

The Inaportnet System will later integrate a standard port information system to serve vessels and goods for both import and  export ship activities
involving service systems at Head Office of Ministry of Transportation. Through this system is expected to improve ship servi ce in the port in order
to run fast, reliable, transparent, and standardized and minimal cost.


Catatan : Progres implementasi dari INAPORTNET s.d Tahun 2018 sudah terintegrasi di 16 Pelabuhan, dan akan di implementasikan kembali p ada
tahun 2019 dengan penambahan 14 pelabuhan. Total pelabuhan yang akan terintegrasi dengan inaportnet menjadi 32 pelabuhan.

Report of The Legal Committee on The

I:\LEG\106\LEG 106-16.docx
Jakarta,      30 Desember 2020

Adopted
DECLARATION ON THE GUIDELINES ON CONSULAR ASSISTANCE BY
ASEAN MEMBER STATES’ MISSIONS IN THIRD COUNTRIES TO
NATIONALS OF OTHER ASEAN MEMBER STATES


We, the Heads of State/Government of Brunei Darussalam, the Kingdom of
Cambodia, the Republic of Indonesia, the Lao People’s Democratic Republic,
Malaysia, the Republic of the Union of Myanmar, the Republic of the
Philippines, the Republic of Singapore, the Kingdom of Thailand, and the
Socialist Republic of Viet Nam:

REAFFIRMING the purposes and principles enshrined in the ASEAN Charter,
as well as our commitment to realise a rules -based, people -oriented and
people-centred ASEAN Community, as outlined in the ASEAN Community
Vision 2025;

REAFFIRMING further our commitment to enhance the well-being of the people
of ASEAN so they can benefit from the process of ASEAN integration and
Community building within and outside of the ASEAN region.

RECALLING the Chairman’s Statement of the 23 rd ASEAN Summit in 2013,
where we noted the idea of extending  support to ASEAN Member States that
do not have permanent representation in third countries to help their respective
nationals in need of consular assistance on a case -by-case basis, through
bilateral arrangements between concerned ASEAN Member States;

REITERATING our agreement in the ASEAN Leaders’ Vision for a Resilient
and Innovative ASEAN to develop the Guidelines on Consular Assistance by
ASEAN Member States Missions in Third Countries to Nationals of other
ASEAN Member States, to strengthen ASEAN’s resilience and ability to serve
its people;

UNDERLINING the importance for ASEAN to enhance its capacity to respond
effectively to existing and emerging challenges that will signify a stronger sense
of unity and common identity;

ACKNOWLEDGING the advancements in regional and international
connectivity and the increasing frequency and number of nationals of ASEAN
Member States traveling outside the region;

Adopted
RECOGNISING ASEAN’s decision to fly the ASEAN Flag at Diplomatic and
Consular Missions of ASEAN Member States in an effort to enhance public
awareness, and sense of ownership and identity to ASEAN;

NOTING the “Guidelines for the Provision of Emergency Assistance by ASEAN
Missions in Third Countries to Nationals of ASEAN Member Countries in Crisis
Situations”;

REITERATING the importance of strengthening ASEAN’s ability to serve its
people including through achieving faster ASEAN’s collective response by
mobilising greater resources and establishing stronger coordination.

DO HEREBY:

WELCOME the adoption of the “Guidelines on Consular Assistance by ASEAN
Member States’ Mission s in Third Countries  to Nationals of other ASEAN
Member States”.

TASK our officials to utilise , as appropriate,  the “Guidelines on Consular
Assistance by ASEAN Member States’ Missions in Third Countries to Nationals
of other ASEAN Member States” which would foster a greater sense of regional
identity and produce tangible benefits to the peoples of ASEAN.

ADOPTED in Singapore, on the Thirteenth Day of November in the year Two
Thousand and Eighteen.

* * * * * *
